creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: painted in underglaze blue; attendant approaching three exotic birds; border with bird and figure cartouches
medium: Porcelain with underglaze blue, enamel and gilded decoration
text: "The Lady with the Parasol" was the first of several designs attributed to the Dutch artist Cornelis Pronk and supplied to the Dutch East India Company for replication on Chinese export porcelain beginning in 1734. Although intended to have an Asian feel, it is clearly Western in execution. The central scene shows a servant holding a parasol over a Chinese lady feeding three birds, two of them European.
title: Imari plate
